definition: cave/hole/zero (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers)/CL:個|个[ge4]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: I will be home after across this tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 過了這個小洞子，就馬上到家了。

sentences.english: Even in winter, fresh vegetables are still available because we can plant them in greenhouses.
sentences.chinese: 即使在冬季，我們也可以喫到新鮮的洞子菜。

sentences.english: The man was known as department head Wang, who told me I was assigned to a Mandongzi School.
sentences.chinese: 告訴我把我具體安排到了一個名叫蠻洞子的中學。

yaodong (a kind of cave dwelling in the Loess Plateau in northwest China)/CL:孔[kong3]
